faller noun [C]
(PERSON/ANIMAL THAT FALLS)
a person who falls to the ground without intending to: I fall over a lot when I ski, but I'm a graceful faller, and I rarely get hurt. Her father is a frequent faller at his retirement home.
a horse or person that falls during a race: The horse was a faller at the 10th fence in the Derby.
More examplesFewer examplesElderly fallers are at more risk of breaking bones.When she toppled over, she took out the whole lamp and side table. She's not a graceful faller.Danoli, a faller at Punchestown on Wednesday, may be retired.Panetta stumbled over another faller, the German Kim Bauermeister, and came a disappointing eighth.
